member.name: T:YalvLib.Common.BindableObject
member.summary: INotifyPropertyChange Implementation Implements the INotifyPropertyChanged interface and exposes a RaisePropertyChanged method for derived classes to raise the PropertyChange event. The event arguments created by this class are cached to prevent managed heap fragmentation. Refs: http://www.codeproject.com/KB/WPF/WPF_NHibernate_Validator.aspx

member.name: T:YalvLib.Common.DisposableObject
member.summary: "Implementing a Dispose method" http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/fs2xkftw.aspx

member.name: M:YalvLib.Common.BindableObject.GetPropertyChangedEventArgs(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an instance of PropertyChangedEventArgs for the specified property name.
member.param: The name of the property to create event args for.

member.name: M:YalvLib.Common.BindableObject.RaisePropertyChanged(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to raise the PropertyChanged event, and invokes the virtual AfterPropertyChanged method, regardless of whether the event was raised or not.

member.name: M:YalvLib.Common.BindableObject.OnAfterPropertyChanged(System.String)
member.summary: Derived classes can override this method to execute logic after a property is set. The base implementation does nothing.

member.name: E:YalvLib.Common.BindableObject.PropertyChanged
member.summary: Raised when a public property of this object is set.

member.summary: Indica se è abilitata la notifica del cambiamento di proprietà

member.name: P:YalvLib.Strings.Resources.About_Description
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to YALV! is a log viewer for Log4Net that allow to compare multiple logs file simultaneously.
MAIN FEATURES: - Log files merging - Dynamic filtering - Dynamic show/hide log levels - Save favorite log folders - Open most recently used files - Column sorting
Log4Net config file must be setup with XmlLayoutSchemaLog4j layout; just need a few lines in your application config file to configure it to use this format (see examples on right).
It is a WPF Application based on .NET Framework 4.0 and writt [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: T:YalvLib.Converter.ZeroToVisibilityConverter
member.summary: XAML mark up extension to convert a 0 or null value into a visibility value.

member.name: M:YalvLib.Converter.ZeroToVisibilityConverter.#ctor
member.summary: Standard Constructor

member.name: M:YalvLib.Converter.ZeroToVisibilityConverter.ProvideValue(System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary:
When implemented in a derived class, returns an object that is provided as the value of the target property for this markup extension.
When a XAML processor processes a type node and member value that is a markup extension, it invokes the ProvideValue method of that markup extension and writes the result into the object graph or serialization stream. The XAML object writer passes service context to each such implementation through the serviceProvider parameter.

member.summary: Zero to visibility conversion method

member.name: T:YalvLib.ViewModel.LogFileLoader
member.summary: This class implements a task based log4net loader that can run in an async task and generate an event when loading is done.

member.name: F:YalvLib.ViewModel.LogFileLoader.mRequestingContext
member.summary:
This property is used to tell the context of the thread that started this thread originally. We use this to generate callbacks in the correct context when the long running task is done
Quote: One of the most important parts of this pattern is calling the MethodNameCompleted method on the same thread that called the MethodNameAsync method to begin with. You could do this using WPF fairly easily, by storing CurrentDispatcher—but then the nongraphical component could only be used in WPF applications, not in Windows Forms or ASP.NET programs.
The DispatcherSynchronizationContext class addresses this need—think of it as a simplified version of Dispatcher that works with other UI frameworks as well.
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms741870.aspx

member.name: M:YalvLib.ViewModel.LogFileLoader.ParseLogFile(System.String)
member.summary: Parse a log4net log file via abstract parser provider class for SQL, Sqlite, XML file etc...

member.summary: Analyze AggregateException (typically returned from Task class) and return human-readable string for display in GUI.
